body:
Hmmh. This may be tricky one, due to tight coupling of format and timezone by JDK. But I'll have a look.
Thank you for reporting this.
Seems like new contributor friendly, will label as such.

rename.from: JsonFormat timezone attribute effect overwritten if pattern attribute present
rename.to: `JsonFormat` timezone attribute effect overwritten if pattern attribute present

body: I just realized that I would need a test case here to see what the problem is: description is not enough to see what is going wrong.
I think this might still be doable, wrt investigation: description suggests how to possibly create the unit test.

repository.name: jackson-datatype-joda
repository.description: Extension module to properly support full datatype set of Joda datetime library
